Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: HRNNY
Reviews.Content: very nice price, very near to Termini station (tube), very clean, nice decoration, internet free in the lobby, you ca let you luggage after checking out while wait to go to the airport/ train, etc. Staff very friendly and helpful giving suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: SteffenThom
Reviews.Content: Quite close to Rome's Termini station, Papa Germano is a very clean and friendly place to stay. The showers are spacious and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and safe - good value”
Reviews.Author: Farhad21
Reviews.Content: Location was excellent near termini and Diocletion baths, friendly staff giving me a free upgrade staying 5 nights, making me return for two more nights, there is good safety three locked doors before getting to your room, off-season promotional rate, I paid €30 per night for a room with common bathroom/shower. Many American tourists being the downside if you want to interact with Italians or other cultures. I recommend it for short stays, for more than 4 nights, pay more for more comfort, there is so much to see in Rome and need good night rest in great comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: HotelRater2012
Reviews.Content: Was a little hard to find after arriving at Rome Termini station via the Leonardo Express from the Airport but it is only about three blocks away. I picked this hotel because it had excellent reviews and my stay here was great! No complaints! Great price for room 80 Euro per night. Did not try the breakfast. Also there is a great reasonably priced pizza place a 2 minute walk away called Pizza Express you should try. I will come back to this hotel whenever I am in Rome in the future!

Reviews.Title: “no regrets here”
Reviews.Author: JustLoveToTravel26
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel about two years ago and was happy about it. So when I went to Rome again this month for two days, I booked this hotel straight away. It is simple clean hotel, nothing fancy. All what you need really. Spend there only few hours at night anyway, cause while in Rome who would like to stay in hotel room-). It was good price 50€ if u pay in cash, 60€ if u use credit card. Nice touch was a little bottle of Prosecco in our room. We did not buy the breakfast which is for 5€ a person so I can not comment on food. Termini station is 5mins walk. Plenty of food places around, but avoid La famiglia where we had really bad expierence. We were in nice home style food restaurant which the guy on reception recommended to us. Unfortunetely i cant remember the name, but it was basement entrance to the restaurant. Anyway, i would always come back to this hotel and would recommend it to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Comfy”
Reviews.Author: asolotraveler40
Reviews.Content: A little hard to find even by the Taxi driver, but I was not disappointed. Located in a little nice, quiet neighborhood, along a cobblestone street with other hotels and restaurants close by. After checking in, I went up the 2 flights of stairs to my 4 bed mixed dorm. (You are given 3 different keys in which to get into the building, upstairs and then into your room. Whew! Though there was a small error in the booking about mixing older with younger people, there was no problem since there was only one other person in the room. Nice and clean with fresh bedding. Clean bathrooms and showers just a skip away with plenty of hot water. Very little space to hang clothes but a nice overhead shelf to put things along with a night stand. I liked the fact that the overhead shelf had a night light to read by and not disturb others. Wow what a really nice, all you can eat, FREE Buffet breakfast consisted of hard boiled Eggs, sliced meats, cereals, pastries, fruit, juice, tea and coffee. Forget your shampoo? They have these wonderful little samples you can try. Nice Touch. They did have free computers to use which was nice. A very large traveling library to peruse your heart out. The main bus and train station is about 3 blocks away where you can take the Tram to see Vatican City or the Colosseum. Nice, friendly staff, willing to help answer your questions about getting around the city. Thanks to all of the Staff for making my stay pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of the ghetto, enjoy the screaming!”
Reviews.Author: TomKat508
Reviews.Content: Once I got off the Termini and walked into the neighborhood where this hotel is at, I knew I was in for an unpleasant surprise. First off, this place is more of a hotel than a hostel. Second, this place is a converted apartment (flat) so the bathrooms are shared. The bathrooms ALWAYS smells like poop because of their plumbing. The hostel part starts and ends in the room because there are no common area for others to mingle. And at night, because this "hotel" is on the 1st floor(2nd floor for USA), you hear all the drunks screaming and yelling at night. You hear all the cars screeching as they pull in and out of the lot. Restaurant choices are pretty poor unless you like doner kebabs. The owner never mentioned anything about breakfast so maybe my former Aussie neighbor who stayed here on the 10th had something special. Also, its a far walk from anything and everything unless you like to see drunks in the park, criminals in the Termini and people selling pashmina in the streets. The good: The beds are comfy, no sagging. The cleaning lady does the beds. So far so good in cleanliness. If you like the price, then ask for a room AWAY from the streets and some of the problems will disappear.

Reviews.Title: “"Let's Go Italy" wrong about Papa Germano's”
Reviews.Author: richard d
Reviews.Content: I've been a user of Lets Go for years but their assessment of Papa Germano's is completely wrong. It's great, really clean, has 4 free internet connections, TVs in rooms, a great included breakfast (not sure if breakfast is always included mine was) which kept me going almost all day. The owner Gino speaks fluent English and grew up in the hotel when it was owed and run by his father. AnnaRita who is on reception most of the time speaks fluent English, she worked in UK for 2 years. All the staff are really nice. It's very close to the station. Let's Go's description of the hotel was so odd that I took it up with Gino. He said he and the whole staff had been really upset by what they wrote but what could he do. He said, 'I know we will never be one of the great famous hotels but we try hard to give people a nice time, a safe place, good food, clean rooms and bathrooms and we try to make people feel that they don't pay too much, it's a fair price and they are happy and they want to come back.' When I told him that I intended to write to Let's Go and complain he told me to wait a moment; he rushed out and returned a few moments later with a very nice bottle of Chianti Classico Reserve insisting that I take it as a present. When we left Gino told my 15 year old daughter that she must come again but not with her Dad, next time you come with your boyfriend and we will take care of you and you will have a very good time. I'm sure Papa Germano's is where she will head for when next in Rome, and so will I.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Bernardo_Mejia
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect, about three blocks away from the Termini Station which is a perfect point to reach any means of transport. We arrived at the Fiumicino Airport and took the Sitbus Shuttle, it drops you at the Termini Station and then took it in the same place to go back to the airport. If you like walking you can go as far as the Colosseum in about half an hour of fourty minutes. We booked a double room and payed about 100 Euros a night which i think is expensive for what you get. Breakfast consists of some fruit, milk, juice, tea, coffee, bread, ham, cheese and hardboiled eggs. Rooms are equipped with a minibar so you can buy food at the supermarket but there's no place to cook. There seems to be a club next to the hotel because every night we were hearing to loud music all night long, even though we were able to sleep perfectly. Staff is super friendly and helpful, no complains whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Great 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gwaladar
Reviews.Content: I visited Rome last year and although the hotel where I stayed was satisfying, I decided this time to try another one. Now I can confirm that I took a good decision, because I really liked this hotel. First of all, it is also very close to the main railway station. It takes 10 minutes on foot to walk from the station to the hotel which, by the way, is found in a quite side street (see attached picture). The area is safe and between the train station and the hotel there are some restaurants, snack bars, an appealing patisserie and, at least, one souvenir shop. The underground and many bus lines can be also taken in the main train station’s area. The hotel occupies the ground floor and some floors of a normal apartment building which looks well maintained (see attached picture). The reception and the breakfast room, in the ground floor, are very clean and renovated. The room where I stayed together with my mother and a sister was also very clean and renovated. It was also spacious (there were 3 single beds), comfortable and pleasant (I’m attaching a picture). The room had a window, air conditioning, a small fridge, a flat screen tv, 1 chair, 1 table and -in the bathroom- a hairdryer. The bathroom, by the way, was small but very clean and modern (I’m attaching a picture too). The sleeping quality was very good. As I said before, the hotel’s street is a side street with almost no traffic at all, so there is no noise. With reference to the staff, they were very nice and helpful (when we asked to print our boarding cards, they didn’t charge anything for the service and the paper) . In the reception area they have 4 computers that guests can use for free to access internet (in our room, in the first floor, we had even wifi). Finally, as usual, let me mention that the breakfast buffet (included in the price of the room) was very satisfying. It consists of bread rolls, small packed croissants, toasts in packages, slices of cheese, slices of ham, butter, several types of jam, sponge cake, fruit cake, orange juice, pear juice, tea, coffee, milk, cereals and fruits like apples or pears. I bet you won’t be able to eat it all . Conclusion: this was a perfect place for my taste and budget.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: braiders12
Reviews.Content: We wanted a base to lay our heads while visiting Rome for 2 nights before travelling on within Italy. Papa Germano was exactly what we needed. The location is great - 5 to 10 mins walk from Termini. A lovely warm welcome from the staff on reception who showed us up to our room on the 2nd floor of the building. The room was fairly small but spotlessly clean. A lovely little bottle of Prosecco had been left in the room for our arrival - a nice touch! We walked for miles around the city so it was nice to come back to a nice cool room and a clean, modern bathroom to freshen up for an evening out. Free internet access if you need it, which is very handy for checking details of places of interest, transport etc. We didn't pay for breakfast in the hotel but there were plenty places nearby for grabbing a cappucino & cake. All in all a great little hotel - handy location, good value and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located within Rome”
Reviews.Author: mario l
Reviews.Content: Papa Germano is conveniently located in walking distance to Rome Termini Station. The hotel is run by a jovial proprietor, Gino Tomasso. The hotel includes 20 rooms, with single, double, tripple and dorm accommodation. There is free internet service. The premises are extremely clean and provide excellent value for its central location. The staff which include Anna Rita, Tarek and Claudio are extremely helpful and knowledgeable. Breakfest is optional. Highly recommended and great value. Mario Lancellotti

Reviews.Title: “HELPFUL staff! average facilities”
Reviews.Author: Miller3581
Reviews.Content: Very good location. The lounge area has only a couch, but there are three computers so accessing the net is not difficult. If you're active about talking to people while they're in the lobby, you can meet some great new friends like I did. The staff is VERY helpful. Annalita helped me get a reservation to see the David in Florence and Claudio gave good advice about how to plan the rest of my trip in Italy. No lockable storage lockers but your bed is behind three keys (one to get in the lobby, one to get in your corridor, one to get in your room). Beds have mattress springs poking through, pillows a bit old. Shower spray in apartment 6 is not very effective but the bathroom is clean and they fixed the clogged drains once they knew it was a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: aspro
Reviews.Content: In a city of expensive hotels, Papa Germano is a great, generally cheaper alternative. Rooms were basic and clean. Bathroom was small but fine. Staff were generally friendly and fairly helpful, while the breakfast was a simple very Italian breakfast experience. The area is a little noisy, but be glad you're off the main streets! There is a market on some days around the corner, and the proximity to Roma Termini and a number of attractions is wonderful. Just a pity there's not much in the way of good restaurant food for normal prices anywhere nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, secure, clean and the best Host in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: domenicburgio
Reviews.Content: Papagermano has become our home in Rome, ands after several stays since 1996, we still love it. Gino is the consumate host, providing every advice imaginable, and never forgetting names (and on occasion birthdays and anniversaries). The rooms are basic, but if safety, security and cleanliness are important to you, you will not be disappointed. His staff are ever reliable and courteous. I recommend Gino's establishment to everyone staying in Rome. Can't wait to return!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: piglover217
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel/hostel in decent location in Rome. Located next to the Termini, provided easy transportation to the rest of Rome. The room was clean and had enough space. Had some problems booking the place, make sure that you confirm your reservation. But the staff was very nice, and even gave us free air conditioning even though they normally charge for it. The street outside was a little loud, so the air conditioning was necessary at night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room and Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: evcheno
Reviews.Content: The place is a short walk from Termini (though we had some difficulty finding our way there). The people serving us were very pleasant and always willing to help. We had a 4 beds room and it was furnished with a sink so that was convenient for us. The 2 shared toilets in each apartment were spacious and clean. The buffet breakfast had limited choices but compared to what you can get from other hostels in Europe, we felt that it was generous enough. Overall, we had a very good experience there.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in great location”
Reviews.Author: sportmanager
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before and enjoyed it that time and this time. A little more money but for the location, clean, quiet and the beds are amazing - best bed in the four hotels we stayed in including a Hilton. You have to pay extra for air conditioning, and the breakfast isn't that great. That said, I would stay there again. Very helpful staff, and just four blocks from the Temini.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel close to the station.”
Reviews.Author: Our_Free_World
Reviews.Content: No problem during check in and the hotel was nice. Double room with shared bathroom was clean. Close to train station (Max 5-7 minutes by walk). We checked in around 11:00 in the night and it was safe to walk in the area. There is a nice cafe near the junction and I was informed well in advance by a friend that if you take the service rather than ordering and taking to go or eat in the cafe standing you will be charged twice the price for the service. Me and My wife had 2 coffee and 2 croissants. It cost 6 Euros as we ordered and ate in the cafe standing near the counter. I asked how much it would have cost if we sat in their cafe and ordered and had the exact same items. They said it would have costed me 14 Euros. I was totally not aware of this and if it had not been for the friend in Italy I would have paid for it without knowing them. just a FYI that I thought I can share.

Reviews.Title: “Very Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: WesNileVirus
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights while visiting Rome and had a double with an ensuite bathroom. The hotel is very clean and the staff is generally polite and helpful. If you're an above average sized person (i.e. tall or fat), the showers and room in general will not suit you. Otherwise, while small, the room was great. I will warn that if you sleep with the windows open, be ready for usual city noise of cars and people's voices. The location is great and about a 10 minute walk from either Termini or Repubblica Metro stations. There is also a nice supermarket a couple blocks away and the room has a refrigerator. If you go there and buy some basic food and beerwine, you can save some serious cash.

Reviews.Title: “Try it and you'll love it !”
Reviews.Author: LauraCCris
Reviews.Content: It's the perfect place to stay, if you're visiting Rome. Close to Termini Station, easy to finde your way around. Very clean, friendly personnel, beautiful rooms, very clean bathrooms (big thanks for that). I had stay there for 5 nights, and I had a wonderful time. I'll stay again at Papa Germano, next time I'll be in Rome. Thank you Papa Germano.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay in Sept '10 - going back in April '11”
Reviews.Author: Ell007
Reviews.Content: I stayed with other uni friends on exchange in Europe for 5 nights at the end of September 2010. Our stay was originally for 4 nights, but they were able to accommodate us for an extra night when we discovered that we loved Rome (and the hotel!) as much as we did. One friend and I shared a double room for two nights - two twin beds verrry close together, sink in room, fan, tv (didn't use it). The shared bathroom down the hall had a good shower and was always clean, though the floor was always wet due to the door not closing quite well. We had another friend join us unexpectedly for our last 3 nights, and they were able to move us to a triple room easily. The room had a bit more space per person, and also had an ensuite bathroom. Unfortunately our shower didn't drain well at all, and we each had to take pauses in our showers to prevent the small basin from overflowing. We didn't mention it to the staff, however, so they can't be faulted for it. The beds in both rooms were comfy, our second room had windows which we opened so that the temperature always cool and comfortable, and bathrooms and rooms always clean. This is Europe, so of course space is minimal, but we didn't have much luggage and it wasn't a problem. The staff are very friendly and helpful. We got restaurant recommendations twice that ended up knocking our socks off - several fantastic places are a short walk away, just ask. Besides the great value and the staff, the best part is the breakfast which is included - breads and jam, eggs, muffins, coffee/tea/juice, cereals and milk, fresh fruit. We all still talk about the incredible crusty rolls that were served at breakfast each morning, they're incredible! I enjoyed my stay so much that I'm returning at the end of April, and very much looking forward to it!

Reviews.Title: “Not Good, Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: Devnani
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights during my visit in July 2010. The rooms are spacious but there is no attached bathrooms in dorms. The hostel people are very laid back. There are many restrictions. They give you 3-4 keys which include key from main door of hotel to key of your room. Not a happening place rather a dull place. They charge 5 Euro for breakfast which they include during online booking. Internet is available for free, also they provide map of Rome and give some tips also. The behavior of staff is cooperative. Centrally located, only 600-800 meters from Roma Termini. Hot water is available but no kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Safe and clean haven in central location”
Reviews.Author: Kardoesie
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased to arrive at Papa Germano after a long plane trip. We were welcomed warmly at the front desk. Our room was ready and was luckily located on the first floor – not too many steps to climb. The room was spotless and spacious enough for two budget travellers. The basin in the room is most practical. The clean, white towels were of good quality, and were changed after two days. We shared two clean bathrooms between about four rooms. Amenities were supplied, plus double ply toilet paper. The hotel is within walking distance from the station and metro, yet very safe. Very conveniently located. We walked from here to the Colloseo, Villa Borghese, the Spanish Steps, in actual fact everywhere in Roma. We only used the metro to go to the Vatican and the bus to visit Trastevere at night. Breakfast is substantial with fresh fruit, juice, water, tea, coffee, cereals, milk, croissants, bread, cake, cold meats, cheese, chocolate spread and jams. The supplies were topped up during breakfast. Free internet is provided. The staff were very helpful with advice of what attractions to visit and where to eat. Although our room did not have a view, we loved the friendly service, the extensive breakfast and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, not so expensive Hotel near to Termini station”
Reviews.Author: Wa1ker
Reviews.Content: Good location which is near to the central Termini Station. It's about 10 minutes walk from the station. The hotel is quite small but comfortable. The breakfast was good too.

Reviews.Title: “Best Price”
Reviews.Author: Gogo9
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just for one night but the price is very good. Excellent location, wonderful breakfast and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect small hotel/hostel”
Reviews.Author: Winsor9
Reviews.Content: This is a very good place where to stay with your frends. Perfect location, wonderful breakfast and budget rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price, great location”
Reviews.Author: Natka3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the main train station so getting to and from the airport was a breeze. The hotel itself is small, simple, but very clean, really a good deal for what some hotels in Rome run. The owner was very friendly and helpful, and the free computers with internet in the lobby were a nice bonus. We walked almost everywhere from this hotel, I think in 4 days we took the metro once, you can really get around easily from here to any of the sights in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: eleanormbowen
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed here when we were on a tight budget. We got a very good rate for clean rooms, a decent location and excellent staff. Definitely no frills, but you'll want to spend your days enjoying beautiful Rome anyway. I was worried about the location, but I did not feel unsafe, and access to the rest of Rome was very easy. The only downside was lack of internet access in the rooms, but there are several computers available for use in the lobby. I feel we definitely got our money's worth. Make sure to talk to Gino who runs the hotel- awesome guy who helped us plan our stay, tolerated my rusty Italian and even sent us on our way with a little vino!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you, Gino!”
Reviews.Author: Lhpdogs
Reviews.Content: The hotel was an easy walk with our luggage from Termini Station; we felt safe going back late at night (although we got lost trying to find it for a little while)! Perfect budget-conscious last night of our Italian vacation! Gino was wonderful to supply a map and recommendations for the perfect 6-hr tour of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Papa Germano is THE place to stay when in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: maylmer
Reviews.Content: We chose Papa Germano as our last stop for our tour of Italy and are so glad we did. The location, near the Termini Train station was ideal for walking directly to the hotel. And the proximity of the hotel to all of the tourist sights was equally perfect (just ask Gino for his walking tour recommendation!) From the minute we walked through the door and were warmly greeted by Gino, to the time we had to say good-bye, we felt at home. The building is safe and secure. The rooms are wonderfuly updated, nicely appointed, clean and spacious - even offering flat screen TV (if you have time for watching!), and the Continental breakfast available in the morning is marvelous. It was Gino that made our stay most complete though. From customizing our "tour map" of the sights, to arranging for our cab ride to the airport the next morning, he made us feel completely welcome. I would highly recommend Papa Germano to anyone traveling to Rome. It's a jewel of a find.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: GugaBurzun
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay! Near Metro, near termini, near almost everything! Recommend for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just Right Amount of Room for the Situation...”
Reviews.Author: uwmitten
Reviews.Content: This secure hostel/hotel was just right and what the three of us needed while staying in Rome. Centrally located right by the Termini Train Station, Hotel PG was clean and had a lot of security, as well as, our own washroom and shower! The room was smaller, but we were never in there and it had great WIFI and internet too that was helpful. I would recommend this to any younger travelers, or to a family as well on vacation for a short stay in the City...

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great location”
Reviews.Author: BigCol4
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 2 other friends and would recomend the place to any budget travellers out there. The staff were very courteous and helpful. The hotel is located within a few minutes walking distance of the main bus/train terminal which makes it very easy to arrive/depart Rome and of course have easy access to all of the sights; there is also free internet which was an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Roma, could be more social”
Reviews.Author: airjesse123
Reviews.Content: Papa Germano was a great place to stay in Rome. While there were some minor annoyances (wet bathroom floors, street noise), the experience as a whole was good. The country mix was nice (I was an American staying with a Canuck and two Brasilians). Ask about the FREE wifi and check out the easy computer access in the lobby. The location is spot on-- Termini can take you to any of the four corners of Rome or to the outskirts of Lazio. I would not recommend the Chinese place accross the street for food. Skip breakfast, he McDonalds serves very good Cappucino for cheap. Papa Germano staff speak excellent english and can point out all POIs and give food suggestions. The Socialness of the Hostel(HOTEL) leaves something to be desired... there is no Lounge beyond the computer desk area...

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Affordable, Excellent and Honest Service!!”
Reviews.Author: ChristineYu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a double room with a private bath for 4 nights. We were satisfied with our room and very pleased with the service that the hotel staff has rendered during our stay. Some strong points with regards to the hotel and our room: (1) Very convenient location – close to the Roma Termini station (10 min walk) (2) Free internet terminals at the hotel lobby (3) Free daily breakfast (4) Small fridge in our room (5) Friendly and approachable staff (The front desk staff can speak English fairly well and always willing to provide directions and assistance when needed) (6) Excellent service – we left our hand-phone in our room during check-out and the hotel took the effort to mail it back to us at no charge; which we were very grateful) Some areas of improvement for the hotel: (1) The towels should be changed more regularly (we noticed that ours were not changed at all) and shampoo sachets were not replenished when used (we had to ask for new ones at the front desk) (2) The private bath in our room did not come with a shower curtain; hence the toilet, including the floor and toilet seat, got very wet after we shower. (3) Our room faces the street; hence it was a bit noisy at night (I would not recommend to people who are “light” sleepers) Overall, this is a very good 1 star hotel. I would strongly recommend Papa Germano to anyone who is looking for a convenient and low cost hotel in Rome. Since this is a low budget hotel, one should not expect too much!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: suefrankw
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a WONDERFUL 5 night stay at this hotel with my adult daughter. We were 1st floor street side. Hotel was not luxury but we did not look for this, we shared a bath and yes some of the others did not mop floor after showers and was a minor annoyance. We had 2 baths to 4 or 5 rooms. Never was a problem. Beds were comfortable and sink in room was great touch. Yes you heard some street noise but not enough to keep us awake- minor. Was quite a nice touch to the ambiance of the area. We walked around the area late til midnight and felt very safe. Very close to train station & I walked all around Rome- took no more than 15-30 minutes to walk to rome's hotspots. Did not utilize breakfast as I am gluten free & they did not offer this option. Staff was very pleasant. Recommended great restaurants in the area=- Andrea's was wonderful- much better than the place we ate at the Pantheon and much less expensive. Hop On /Off bus was 5 minutes walk. Internet & WiFi was a great plus. It was not the Ritz Carlton but that is not what we were looking for or wanted to pay for. We loved it and the very good price, right in the city. We will return and refer our friends here for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Hope You're Not Staying On the Street Side...”
Reviews.Author: NYUAlumCouple
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel our last night in Italy because we wanted something close to the train station-which it is. However, we did not bargain for the experience we would get. Got into our room, which was fine. Although the TV would be on for a few minutes and then freeze. We could never get it to work right. But the real problem was how noisy the street was. Multiple other hotels and multiple restaurants meant alot of people making alot of noise all night long. The windows did absolutely nothing to block out the sound and at 3am we were wide awake thanks to obnoxious fellow travelers right outside our window. And to add to the terrible night we were having, the TV all of a sudden kept blinking it's blue power light on and off which would only stop when we unplugged it. As a side note, this side of the Termini was a little shady and we wouldn't recommend walking around after dark for too long.

Reviews.Title: “As a backpacker hostel, Papa Germano...”
Reviews.Author: tangiwai
Reviews.Content: As a backpacker hostel, Papa Germano would be excellent. But I would only rate their private rooms as average. Located within 5 mins walk from Termini station, area feels slightly dodgy but safe enough. However Termini is an excellent transport hub and a combination of the metro and/or bus will get you to most sights in Rome. Rooms are average quality - size is accetable, furniture is dated, clean enough. Bed just fits my 5'9" frame, beware tall people. Shared bathrooms vary in cleaniness but really depends on your neighbours. Had 5 quiet nights sleep. Free Internet and wifi in the lobby is a bonus. All staff were great. As Rome is expensive, this place is perfectly livable for the price, but I would personally spend a little more next time to live somewhere more central.

Reviews.Title: “Still a good stay...”
Reviews.Author: SereneSwee
Reviews.Content: We have a hard time finding this little gem tucked away from the hustle and bustle of the city but it's mainly our fault as we followed the instruction given in googlemap which leads us a big round way. =( When we first arrived, we were quite disappointed by the appearance of the hotel. Old facade with dark and eerie stairway. We stayed in a triple room which is quite small as there wasn't really enough space for the 3 of us to unpacked. We have a basin in our room and there is a bad smell coming from the pipe I think. However, the room was really very clean. As for comfortable, of course we cannot expect soft bed and fluffy pillows/quilt with the kind of price we r paying. We stayed on the second floor, with view of a small street with a bakery. Early in the morning around 4am on our first morning (Fri), it was really very noisy with people talking and car honking. People are setting up their morning market stalls and unloading goods. Its really quite frustrating especially when we did not have sufficient sleep. However, looking on the bright side, its really interesting to listen to the way Italian speaks. The location is quite convenient and safe especially if you need to catch early morning trains at Termini. Breakfast so-so and everyday is the same. Coffee sucks though. An old staff at the reception doesn't look friendly and didn't offered any advise when we asked for recommended dining venue around the hotel. But there was a younger man who was friendlier and more willing to advise us where to eat when we tried our luck asking again on the next day. Overall, Its a good stay and we will definitely return. Probably book a room without breakfast if possible. =)

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, close to public transportation”
Reviews.Author: StudentTraveler57
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 4 bed mixed dorm. The room was comfortable and we had 2 bathrooms on our floor of maybe 5 rooms, no lockers for luggage though. Both bathrooms had showers and were clean. The neighborhood around Termini isn't great but being close to the metro/train station/ bus station was worth it. We arrived at the train station, took the metro early each morning to the major sites to avoid long lines and could catch a bus to the airport all without hauling our bags very far. I would pay for A/C if it was going to be hot, keeping the window open was loud. The restaurant/business across the street from our window was busy late. Satellite TV in room was great and the free hour of internet a day was a lifesaver.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place in the center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: FunFunOK
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend is italian and we alwais come to Rome; we love it! We found this place on this website dince it's located near the station and the historical center. So perfect for us! we had a beautiful time here. Thanks to all the staff (very helpful). Wonderful breakfast and free wifi. We recommend this place if you are looking for a good place on a budget price!

Reviews.Title: “Gracious hosts”
Reviews.Author: GStarNYC
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest experiences I've had in a "budget" hotel - and I am used to staying in very cheap places! Papa Germano's rooms are very comfortable, clean, and spacious. Plenty of drawers, wardrobe, etc. so I really moved in for the week. The bathrooms were also spotless, the showers hot and good water pressure (if a bit small). Use of the computers was free and they were not slow, as I've seen some reviews say. And don't be put off by the rep of the Termini neighborhood - PG is north of the station, which is much more savory than south. I always felt safe and there was a street market every day, a great bakery (3P - Treppi) very close by, and the street is very quiet. Most of all, I loved the staff of Papa Germano - always so helpful anytime I needed any directions, advice, etc. I felt very much at home and when in Rome again I will be back at PG. They are incredibly gracious hosts and run a very professional establishment!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnTedge
Reviews.Content: From the time you meet the genial manager, Gino, you will feel welcome in this hotel. Good location close to Temini station (10 minute walk) and metro trains and buses. Colosseum, Forum, Spanish Steps and Villa Borghese are easy walk. Our room was large enough and comfortable with TV, wash basin, refrigerator, wardrobe, desk and chair and bedside tables. Our room on this trip was with shared bathroom (save €10-€25). The bathrooms are very clean and modern and we never had to wait. The breakfast is good and substantial. Staying in this location also affords the opportunity to lunch or dine at the wonderful rosticceria "i Molisani" (eat-in or take away - 10 minute walk). I won't divulge the location but if you want to treat yourself to delicious and very affordable food varieties then search the Web for the address and reviews. Yum

Reviews.Title: “LifeSaver”
Reviews.Author: khink29
Reviews.Content: This place gave us a deal the first night for a hotel room and it was great. The staff was very nice and accommodating. We especially liked the nice, young, reception lady. She was so easy to work with. We stayed a few more nights in their hostel on the top floor (no elevator, definitely a walk) there's no a/c up there so it was pretty hot (there was a fan) and no private bathroom but they really keep it pretty clean and it's a small hostel so we never had a problem with running into someone else using the bathroom when one of us needed to. Also a mini-fridge upstairs for hostel-stayers so we stocked up on O.J. as we were both pretty sick during our stay in Rome. We would definitely stay here again, prices were great, reasonable breakfast, lovely staff. Pretty quiet at night too :)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: HistoryBuffBangalore
Reviews.Content: Good, clean rooms. Very helpful staff and Gino is a warm and friendly hotel-owner. Excellent for budget travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: grmupy
Reviews.Content: Value for money. Central location - close to bus and train stations. The room are not grand, but good enough for budget travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Thw owner is a very kind person”
Reviews.Author: ray7040
Reviews.Content: It's convenient to live here, because it's just around the termini station. It's a clean and comfortable place. It also provided free computer and internet. What's most important, papa Germano is a kind and interesting person.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: khakiydax
Reviews.Content: If you are booking a stay at Hotel Papa Germano--don't expect luxurious accomodations. This hotel/hostel is far from luxurious but it is clean, affordable and in the center of the city. A small breakfast is included (which is great if you are traveling on a budget) and the employees are very friendly and helpful. If you are traveling during the HOT season--be sure and splurge the extra dollars for air conditioning. After a long hot day of sightseeing nothing is better than the air and the cold floors in the room (if you've been smart enough to leave your air on while you were gone). I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel, Nice Staff; sketchy neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: andyh997
Reviews.Content: Room was clean. The staff when above and beyond trying to help me. The area about the train station is a little problematic.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlisonfromAus
Reviews.Content: After travelling all night from Paris by train, we were wrapped to be greated by Gino then told our room was available right away. This allowed us to shower & unpack before Gino gave us maps of Rome & advice on getting about the city. The rooms were very small but were clean. each morning they were serviced & very well too. We had breakfast the first morning but found it very dissapointing, my 12yr old son was not impressed comig from Paris. We found a cafe around the corner & all had coffee/hot chocolate & crosaunts each morning for $7 euro....bargin! This area is bustling day & night thankfully as it wasnt the ritzy part of rome & a number of interesting people were around at night. Must say I felt safe at all times walking with my husband & kids, wouldnt chance as a lone female though. We stayed for 5 nights but night 3 we had a group of 20 somethings move into a room across the hall. 1st night I was woken at 3.30am with their drunken song, I was not happy but after 5 or 10 mins there was silence. Then the next night exactly the same thing happened. this time it didnt stop after 10 mins so I walked into the hall & knocked loudly on their door. I was greeted by a Polish backpacker with his fly undone & a stupid grin on his face. I ranted at him telling him how rude & inconsiderate they were untill he said sorry. The next morning they left! Apart from that it was a good budget (as budget as you can get at $140 euro a night) hotel & served our family well. Warning.! Be advised to travel light as there are no lifts & no help was offered to lug our bags upstairs even though we had 2 children to get upstairs as well as all our bags. There is a sign saying do not drag bags up stairs....in our circumstances that was not possible & expecting too much. In fact we left there to go to Venice over night & my husband pulled a muscle in his shoulder so we had to pay for a 1 bedroom unit on our floor to store bags ovrnight. we just couldnt drag them up again. Overveiw Clean & central hotel with very friendly & helpful owner (Gino). Good basic accomadation easy 5 minute walk from Roma Termini (main train station). Colourful area

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Rome. Friendelly Staff. Dirty blanket.”
Reviews.Author: Brazucanomundo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located, near Termini. Quiet place. The staff is very fiendily and we paid 100 euros/day for a good room. It was OK and clean, but the blanket and the sheet were very dirty, spotted with something like blood. I think is just a big mistake in a good hotel, so I recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and brilliant location!”
Reviews.Author: lenny84
Reviews.Content: Hotel Papa Germano was more of a hostel hotel combi. The rooms were very clean as was the shared bathroom. The staff were extremely friendly and gave good advise when needed. Air con costs five euros extra per night but is defiantly worth the investment at the peak of summer. Hotel Papa Germano is only a five minute walk from Rome's main train station.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL STAY”
Reviews.Author: Wow_Belgium
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Gino and all the staff for the wonderful stay. The room was very clean and the staff helpfull. Great breakfast and internet point at the reception. This is a good choice to all the the people that want to stay in the centr on a budget. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good price”
Reviews.Author: NewZealandLee09
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hostel for one night at the end of May because we couldn't find other places offered under 100 euro a night with bathroom. Afterall, we were happy for the stay. The room and bathroom was reasonable sized and fairly clean. It's close to the train station. And there are some computers to use for free in the lobby. If you want cheap, clean and close to Termini's accommodation, Papa Germano is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with a awesome breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: luvdaisie
Reviews.Content: Papa Germano's was one of the best places I stayed at. It was easy to find and near the main train station which gives you access to all of the city. It was surrounded by restaurants and stores. This hostel was more like a hotel, it has a tv, phone and sink in the room which made it convenient. The breaksfast wasn't just bread and jam, it included meat, cheese, hot cereal, cold cereal, juice, fruit - it was like a mini buffet!! Papa Germano and his staff were very helpful in giving directions to the sights. I really wished I had stayed longer there.

Reviews.Title: “Great home base”
Reviews.Author: TeacherandDad
Reviews.Content: The Papa Germano Staff was the friendliest and most helpful we had in Europe. The building, lobby, breakfast room and rooms have a lot of character and are spotlessly clean. The location was very good - it was only a ten minute walk to Termini Station where we caught buses and subways for our twice daily excursions to sites. Our room was small, which we have come to expect in European budget hotels, but with the bunks we had plenty of room for our family of four. The large cabinet/closets above the beds were great for organizing our gear. Guests are issued three keys for security - one for the front door, one for your wing or hallway, and one for the room. The continental breakfast was good - great Italian coffee. Our teenagers really enjoyed being able to get on the Internet for free every day. The canyon-like streets of Rome carry sound so I would recommend earplugs (people are out and about all night). I would also recommend buying a RomaPass for free admission to two sites and unlimited transportation on the easy to use buses and subway.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, OK location, poor breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: bellmeister
Reviews.Content: At €105 per night for a double with bathroom, you will be hard pressed to find better in Rome. It's a bit dated but the rooms are a decent size, clean and beds comfortable, although 2 singles pushed together. No safe in room. Location is a bit dodgy but only 10 min walk to termini or barbican metro. Can also walk to colosseum, pantheon and trevi fountain. We also caught the number 40 bus a few times. Breakfast is poor, we didnt bother after the first day. There is a small cafe around the corner on via volturno where you can get an excellent coffee and pastry for €1.40. Internet free but very slow, gave up trying in the end. Basically, if you are on a budget, stay here, if not, stay further west.

Reviews.Title: “All right but would not return”
Reviews.Author: voyageuse_81
Reviews.Content: I really cannot understand how this place is so highly recommended. It wasn't TERRIBLE, but I would recommend friends or family to seek another place, whether or not they were after hostel accommodation. Of course there are pros, but there were cons too. Perhaps we dont appreciate Rome's standard and maybe it's really low, but we just found this place to be lax. We pre-booked months in advance via the hotel on their website and were given room 110 on level 2 (a quad room for 95 euros a night if paid in cash, booked directly through the hotel) which had two bunk beds and a double (2 singles pushed together). Here are the pros and cons in no particular order... CONS - The room was clean enough, but the bathroom floor had some pubic hair - bleh. shower was really bad - about 4 water shoots, the stall was tiny and filled up after under 2 minutes. - Breakfast was REALLY crap. Even for a cheap included breakfast, there was absolutely nothing - pre packaged croissants covered in sugar, some jams, 2 types of cereal in plastic cups and some tea and coffee. We only ate in once in 4 days becuase there was just nothing there - I really felt like they could at least include some fruit or other pastries? - The place was SO noisy. Our first 2 nights, we were all woken up sooo many times through the night with yelling from fellow residents. Not the hotel's fault, but the rooms were entirely un-soundproof and we could hear people in teh corridors, coming up the stairs etc - Absolutely no view from the hotel room, but no big deal - The shower was really terrible... tiny shower stall so if youre a bigger person you would have a hard time, bottom of shower filled up after 30 seconds and didnt drain for a while - We had no hot water or heating for over 24 hours and when we told the older man on reception, he said "sorry, cant do anything until tomorrow" with no apology or anything... really annoyed us that their attitude was so "who cares?" - There are 4 computers in reception but there were only ever 2 turned on, despite a few people often waiting to use the internet. You can use 30 mins free each day, but the computers are so slow and old that if you get on Facebook or your email, it crashes half the time and just takes forever to load a page PROS - Beds were comfortable enough but it's always annoying to have 2 singles pushed together to form a "double". The bunk beds were not bad but the bottom one had springs coming up that stuck into my sister's back. They were also old and noisy so whenever someone turned you could hear it. - Bed sheets were relatively clean (only a few stray hairs) and comfortable enough - Room had a TV with CNN, MTV and a bunch of Italian channels, but at least enough to watch some news if that's waht you're after Staff are not really remarkable either way. Nobody offered any sort of local advice like we got in other European cities like Vienna and Prague, but they werent rude or anything. Not helpful, but no problems in particular. THe location was okay - about a 10 minute walk from Termini station which gets you anywhere, and only a few stops from Colosseum metro stop or the Trevi fountain etc. Fairly central, but not in the best part of town. We basically just left ROme wiht a bitter taste in our mouths. THe best meal we ate in 4 days were the baguettes with bresaola and mozzarella we made ourselves from supermarket stuff. Restaurant staff are surly, even when I spoke Italian - everybody wants to rip you off, the food is abysmal (we got tinned pasta sauces), house wine tasted like vinegar... plus they charge you 10% for "service" when service was shocking. Every tourist attraction is filled with hawkers, scam artists trying to make you buy their stuff, and tehy're REALLY aggressive. We are 27, 27, 23 and 21 and all couldnt wait to leave to Florence and Pisa. In all, I would not recommend this hotel to anyone but would also make it known that I have not stayd anywhere else in Rome and do not know the standards etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms and price”
Reviews.Author: One-Human-World
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a dorm with 3 people. This was a good size room for 4 people if you were not travelling with too much luggage. Each of us had a confortable bed and nice beding. The quality was more as a hotel rather then popular dorms. We had 2 good size and clean bathrooms to share with 3 rooms. The security in the hostel is very good, as you need a key to enter in your appartment where are 3 private rooms, then you need a second key to enter in your room. The breakfast was very good with selection of cheese, egg, cereals, pastery, juices, tea, coffee and water. The staff was friendly and they speak English. The hotel was modern, clean, good value and just few blocks from the train station. I found the area very safe even walking at night when it was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay for the people!”
Reviews.Author: angelle008
Reviews.Content: This was the one of the best places I stayed, The rooms were clean, fairly priced and the people were so helpful. I did not speak any Italian and I was travel alone; they really take care of you! If you go ask for Gino, and tell him I say hello:)

Reviews.Title: “best place where I've been”
Reviews.Author: crista7878
Reviews.Content: We were very excited to discover a real value place that worth the money.We found the reception employees really helpfull and kind.They received us friendly, explaining us the map in every particulary, giving us suggestions what to visit in a short time, where to eat god and cheap.Regarding the room we can say that were very clean with all comforts, in a word seemed to be like home.The hotel is at only 10 minutes from the main station, and in the same time central.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable accomodation in Rome”
Reviews.Author: mbellny
Reviews.Content: Clean and secure accomodation in Rome. Price was reasonable and it is only a few blocks from the train station. The owners were nice. They have an excellent internet setup that is very reasonably priced. Breakfast was good. I would recommend this place, as far as hostels go it is quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!!”
Reviews.Author: FlyingJZ
Reviews.Content: I almost hate to rave about the place lest they become too popular and difficult to book in the future. After doing a two week 'budget' trip to Rome and England, this hotel was the star of the trip. Our Quad room was clean and freshened each day. It had a large window that opened onto a quiet street. The shared bathrooms were equally clean and nicely appointed. There is no elevator, so be willing to climb stairs which was not a problem for us. The staff was exceptionally helpful and courteous. Breakfast was more than adequate to get the day going with cereal, fruit, and pastries. The icing on the cake were the computer terminals available in the lobby, free of charge!! In a day when you get banged for computer access, it was wonderful to have it available free. We had no problem feeling our luggage was safe in the lobby our last morning there after we checked out. While it is not right next to the Termini, it is close enough to walk and easily find and far enough to avoid the dilapidated neighborhood and riff raff immediately surrounding the station. Highly recommend to budget travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Outstaning Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jaegerak
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Rome to experience the cultural and immerse yourself in the city, Papa Germano is the first step! We needed a room for two adults and two teen children that would not cost us $400.00 per night and this was the ticket! What an excellent choice! With a local market outside the hotel entrance every morning and perfect pizza around the back corner and a five minute walk to the train station, this value cannot be beat. Great service by a smiling staff and a wonderful Italian breakfast served each morning. If you are going to Rome to experience the city and all it has to offer, spend your money where it will create memories. You can save a bundle by staying at Papa Germano, besides all you need is a place to lay your head a few hours a night. If you are in your hotel anymore than that, then shame on you!

Reviews.Title: “Nice cheap hostel”
Reviews.Author: monozygote
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant owners who speak English. We had a dorm room which was fine, some have a fan as well. Nice and clean, located close to Termini station (but this isn't the nicest area in Rome). Only one problem- they tend to move people during their stay, so you get all cosy in one room and then they moved us after 2 days for reasons unknown. Breakfast was nothing special, but then we have just been around Italy for 2 weeks and most were not great.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect cost and location”
Reviews.Author: Speeza
Reviews.Content: Good value for money! Breakfast is included, and it is an excellent breakfast. Staff all speak English and are helpful. Well kept and clean. Right by the Termini station; easy to find and within walking distance of everything you need. Only con: the stairs. Our room was on the top floor, and trust me, it is a hike up. By the third day however, you'll be broken into it.

Reviews.Title: “graet value and location”
Reviews.Author: larry13413
Reviews.Content: Four of us shared a quad room and it was very nice - clean and safe, quiet,decent beds,spotless bathrooms, good continental breakfast. Internet was cheap, staff were very friendly and helpful. Location was perfect, only a 5 min walk from termini station. Price was much cheaper than other hotels in area for 4 people. Overall we were very happy!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: GirlWithCurls
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a trip to Rome, and highly recommend this hotel/hostel. I stayed in a double room, with shared bathroom. The hotel is very conveniently located near Termini Station, in an area with many other hotels, shops and restaurants. It's an easy walk to all the main sights of Rome. The staff were always very helpful, friendly and willing to offer sightseeing advice. My room came with free breakfast, which consisted of tea, coffee, rolls, ham, cheese, fruit cocktail, cereal, juice and packaged croissants. It's very clean and good value for money. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A good value”
Reviews.Author: RoyR
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. The room, a 4 person dorm, was clean and quiet and on the fifth floor (no lift). There are no lockers or telephone or television in the room I stayed in. The other guests were a mellow and nice bunch, not rowdy party goers. The shared bathroom was clean and there was a small refrigerator in the hall which was handy for cooling a drink in the otherwise warm beverage city of Rome. The beds (twin sized) were comfortable and the hotel was clean. A small fan was provided and appeciated. This hotel, like all others in this price range does not have air conditioning. There are no laundry facilities but there are some cheap 2 hour laundry services within a block of the hotel. There were also lots of internet cafes within 3 minutes of the hotel. The accomodations are basic, but a good value if you're just looking for a place to sleep and shower while conquering Rome. The breakfast was reasonable by Italian standards; rolls, meat, cheese, juices, coffee and cereal. I found the location, several blocks from the train / metro station, to be very handy for getting around Rome. The real plus was the staff. I found them to be friendly, easy to get along with and very helpful in answering questions or helping with directions. Papa G was onsite and ran a tight ship. You could tell he cared about his small hotel. I'd stay here again. Thanks, Roy from Spanaway, WA

Reviews.Title: “A long way to the top.”
Reviews.Author: Prenexus
Reviews.Content: Hotel was located a bit far from central rome to walk, but was close enough to bus and trains. Room was nice and clean only complaint was we didn't have a TV which was advertised to have. Breakfast was very good with a bit of variety and nice and fresh. Try to book a room that is not on the top floor its a long way up without a lift. This was the only hostel we had to wait for a shower or a toilet, on our floor there were three rooms with 7 people sharing an en-suite. (the toilet was in with the shower, so this meant two people couldn't be using the facilities at the same time.) also no hooks for towel and no toilet paper holder in bathroom so everything got wet. Also there was a fridge on our floor and a great little supermarket on the bottom level of the train station, so we where able to buy things like fruit and keep them in the fridge. Very friendly staff, reasonably priced internet, good security, would recommend to anyone on a budget who want to be located near the Termini Train Station.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay again”
Reviews.Author: AdelaideMarilyn
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in July and had 2 rooms. One double room which was large and spotless but the bathroom, although newish was a bit small as my husband is well over 6ft. My 3 teens stayed in a very large room with 3 single beds with a much larger bathroom. The fact the hotel was near the Railway Station was a big plus for us. Never felt threatened. Great breakfast and the host, Gino, was fantastic. Would stay there again as the price was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Okay not too bad”
Reviews.Author: Willy_Roger
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a total of four nights in the hotel. The hotel was very near to Station Termini which is easy access to the metro. The double bed room which I have is fairly small but adequate with fridge (very important in summer) and a small bathroom. The staff in the pension is quite friendly especially the one who tend the reception from late afternoon to evening. Cleanliness of the room was fair but could be better improved. Overall, this is a average hotel with little frills.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Family Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I liked this place! Walking distance from Roma Termini...if you like to walk. It was secure because, I believe, they give you a key to the main entrance to the hotel as well as a key for your own room. It was safe. The rooms we're nice, bathrooms we're clean and best of all our family of 4 had a comfortable rest after a week of travelling! ;)

Reviews.Title: “Papa Germano Stay”
Reviews.Author: MS319
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in the beginning of June, 2004 when we ran into problems with our hostel reservations. The double room was very pretty with dark wood and plenty of storage space (85 euros). There was also a TV and mini fridge, and a large widow overlooking the street. The reception was friendly and the rate for internet use was cheap. We had a great stay here, and we'll return on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Family Friendly in Rome”
Reviews.Author: PittsburghTraveler99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 3/15/04-3/20/04 during a family trip to Rome. The hotel was clean, safe and well maintained. The rooms were basic but were a great value in Rome. The street was noisy at night if you tried to keep window open but okay with window closed. Close enough to walk to most sights, but it is a fairly long walk. Would stay here again!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Papa Germano
HotelInfo.Address: Via Calatafimi 14A, 00185 Rome, Italy
